intro: Vilfa varians, commonly known as the variable violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, violet-blue petals that often display intricate patterns. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and a short stem. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
